definition.para: A name given to the resource.

instructions.para: A brief descriptive phrase that includes these elements, generally in this order: who, what, where, when.

The Title is a concise sentence which will be used to label the thumbnails in CONTENTdm; it will also be the first line of the descriptive information. The Title may be the caption assigned by the photographer or the collector, or it may be created by Special Collections staff from the given caption and from additional sources. In the absence of any caption, the Title will be provided by Special Collections staff.
If the caption provided by the photographer is adequate, place it in the Title field. Then, the Notes field should include this phrase: Title taken from photograph.
If the caption provided by the photographer is inadequate, a created title should be placed in the Title field; the Notes field should then read: Caption on image: "Image title."

If there is a series caption, it should be added, in the Notes field, in sequence after the title on the image: Caption on image: "Image title"; "Series title." There should also be a separate notation in the Notes field in the form: Part of Hegg series entitled: "Series title."
A brief descriptive phrase that includes these elements, generally in this order: who, what, where, when.

The Title is a concise sentence which will be used to label the thumbnails for the compound objects in CONTENTdm; it will also be the first line of the descriptive information. The Title may be a caption assigned by a photographer/creator/contributor or the collector, or it may be created by Special Collections staff from the given caption and from additional sources. In the absence of any caption, the Title will be provided by Special Collections staff.

If the caption provided by a photographer/creator/contributor is adequate, place it in the Title field. Then, the Notes field should include a phrase like this: "Title taken from photograph" or "Title taken from text attached to resource."

If the caption provided by a photographer/creator/contributor is inadequate, a created title should be placed in the Title field; the Notes field should then read something like: 'Caption on image: "Image title" ' or 'Title provided by University of Washington Libraries staff.'

If there is a series caption, it should be added in the Notes field; the note should begin "Series Title: "; the note should be in sequence after the notes describing the title (for example, the 'Caption on image: "Image title" ' note). There should also be a separate notation in the Notes field in the form: Part of Hegg series entitled: "Series title."
Every page must have a title.

Enter a title for the single item/page. This could be a descriptive title for the content of the item, a transcribed title, or a title that helps administer the overall object, whatever works best for the project.

customization.para: Enter a descriptive title, minimally stating the name of the building (or proposed building), a description of the drawing (for example, "interior details"), and a description of the area of the building represented in the drawing (for example, "ground floor entrance and corridor").

example.para: Alger house, interior view of living room Seattle, Washington, 1955
Woman mushing wood, Chilkoot Trail, ca. 1898
Lyman Whitney Strong Jr. letter to his brother Arthur Tappan Strong, February 23, 1862

customization.para: White Building (Seattle, Wash.), interior details for the ground floor entrance and corridor
Albert S. Kerry residence (Seattle, Wash.), dining room details
B.P.O. Elk's Lodge (Centralia, Wash.), Pearl Street elevation
Bjarne Moe student drawing of a commemorative tablet

dcgNotes.para: Indicators must be set manually to 00.
Former profile also mapped to 520_8#_$a, "Summary." This mapping no longer used.

history.justification: For CONTENTdm collections; all CONTENTdm collections require titles.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: An alternative name for the resource.

instructions.para: Enter an alternative title; may or may not follow instructions for entering titles.
When applicable, add a note in the Notes field describing the source of the alternative title.

history.justification: Alternative titles are often needed on the digital collections.

definition.para: The name of the architect or firm who created the architectural work depicted in the image. I

instructions.para: Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.
The name should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image.
Includes both personal and corporate names.
The name should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image. Includes both personal and corporate names.

history.justification: Architect appears frequently enough that we would like to expose the role of this "creator" using the label "architect."

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The name of the associate architect or firm who helped create the architectural work depicted in the image. It should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image. Includes both personal and corporate names.

instructions.para: Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

history.justification: Associate architect was known frequently enough in Architecture of the Pacific Northwest to warrant the use of this field.

definition.para: The name of the engineer or firm who helped create the architectural work depicted in the image. It should represent as closely as possible the engineer’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image. Includes both personal and corporate names.

instructions.para: Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

history.justification: Engineer was known frequently enough in Architecture of the Pacific Northwest to warrant the use of this field.

definition.para: The name of the artist or firm who created the art work depicted in the image. Most often this art work will be associated with an architectural work also depicted in the image. The name should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image. Includes both personal and corporate names.

instructions.para: Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

history.justification: Engineer was known frequently enough in Architecture of the Pacific Northwest to warrant the use of this field.

definition.para: Name of the entity using the services provided by the entities to whom the resource is attributed.

instructions.para: Enter the name of the person or firm who is the architect's client.
More often than not the entry represents the entity that will make use of the building.
The form of the name should be the form at the time of the creation of the image.

history.justification: The Architecture of the Pacific Northwest idntified many clients that were potentially useful to know.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

example.para: If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF can be one of several options including "1855?/1999?"
If Date field = "before 2007" then Date EDTF is either "/2007" or "../2007"
If Date field = "after 2001" then Date EDTF is either "2001/" or "2001/.."
If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF can be one of several options including "1855?/1999?"
If Date field = "before 2007" then Date EDTF is either "/2007" or "../2007"
If Date field = "after 2001" then Date EDTF is either "2001/" or "2001/.."

admin.para: This document needs a reference to the final spec.

For the xsd, datatype is xs:string; the datatype is more accurately http://id.loc.gov/datatypes/edtf, which is not a valid QName and is inavlid according to schema-4-properties, but this does not seem to be machine-actionable; more exploration needed.

generalNotes.para: EDTF is still a standard in progress. It has not yet been accpted as a full recommendation. It should be voted on in 2018 by ISO. We are anticipating it will becoming a 2-part ISO 8601-2018.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (EDTF) required by Orbis Cascade Dublin Core Best Practices (https://www.orbiscascade.org/dublin-core-best-practices).

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Also updated link to EDTF and added some instructions.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: If the resource is a photograph, the date the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the date the artwork was created.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
before YYYY
after YYYY
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date when the image/resource in hand was produced is known, and is different from that of the original image, so note in the Notes field.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using a date format listed above.
If the resource is a photograph, the date the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the date the artwork was created.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
before YYYY
after YYYY
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date when the image/resource in hand was produced is known, and is different from that of the original image, so note in the Notes field.
If the date is unknown, an attempt should be made to assign an approximate date, using an appropriate date format listed above.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
before YYYY
after YYYY
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using a date format listed above.

history.justification: We need a display dates field that will be easy for users to understand. It does not need to be indexed but it seems OK to map to Dublin Core.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Also added instruction.
Added customix=zations for Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Enter the year or years only.
If the resource is a photograph, the year the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the year the artwork was created.
If the date is a single year, year and month, or year month and day, enter the single year only in the Dates field.

If the date is an approximate year, enter that year plus five years on either side of that year; for example, if the Date field is "1910?" enter "1905 1906 1907 1908 1909 1910 1911 1912 1913 1914 1915"
If the year is a range of years, enter all the years in that range.
This field is indexed and enables date searching in CONTENTdm.
The Dates value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Date fields.
Enter the year or years only.
If the resource is a photograph, the year the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the year the artwork was created.
If the date is a single year, year and month, or year month and day, enter the single year only in the Dates field.

If the date is an approximate year, enter that year plus five years on either side of that year; for example, if the Date field is "1910?" enter "1905 1906 1907 1908 1909 1910 1911 1912 1913 1914 1915"
If the year is a range of years, enter all the years in that range.
This field is indexed and enables date searching in CONTENTdm.
The Dates value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Date fields.
If the date is a single year, year and month, or year month and day, enter the single year only in the Dates field.

If the date is an approximate year, enter that year plus five years on either side of that year; for example, if the Date field is "1910?" enter "1905 1906 1907 1908 1909 1910 1911 1912 1913 1914 1915"
If the year is a range of years, enter all the years in that range.
This field is indexed and enables date searching in CONTENTdm.
The Dates value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Date fields.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.
Enter the year or years only.

history.justification: We need a field that can be indexed in CONTENTdm in a way that allows all the years in a date range to be indexed. It should not be mapped to a Dublin Core property and it should be hidden from the public.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Added an instruction.

definition.para: Denotes genre or type of material.

instructions.para: Input a term or terms taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the thesaurus.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.
Input a term taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
If more than one term is applicable, list the form of the item scanned first.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.
Optional: input a term taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Not required for all compound object items. Use as needed. Recommended: enter type values when the collection resources are mixed media.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

customization.para: Input a term taken from the Art and Architecture Thesaurus at http://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/aat/.
Recommended but not required for all compound object items.
Especially important to enter when the collection resources are mixed media.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

example.para: Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]
Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]
Negatives [a collection of negatives described as a collection]
Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a description of the resource type.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Includes additional descriptive information about type of material or medium, color, and dimensions.

instructions.para: Input a term taken from Graphic Materials: Rules for Describing Original Items and Historical Collections.
Input a term taken from Graphic Materials: Rules for Describing Original Items and Historical Collections.

customization.para: Ink and watercolor on drafting cloth: 48 x 46 cm.
Gouache/watercolor with graphite and ink on paper with cheesecloth backing ; 40 in x 29 3/4 in
Ink and graphite on drafting cloth: 61 x 93 cm

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a description of original resource's format.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Added customization for Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection.

definition.para: The street addresss of the building created using the drawing.

instructions.para: In cases where the drawing was realized and the address of the building is known, enter the street address.
Enter the street address as it is commonly known.
Enter the best street address available at which the building is located.

history.justification: The project wanted to give the exact street address, when available, of the building created using the drawing.

definition.para: The location of the building realized using the drawing.

instructions.para: Enter Country--State or Province--City.
Places names are derived from the LC Authority File.

example.para: Croatia--Zagreb [use current form, even though Yugoslavia was the name when the photo was taken]
Russia (Federation)--Leningradskaia oblast--Saint Petersburg [use current form, even though the location was called Leningrad in Soviet Union, when photo was taken]
Croatia--Zagreb [use current form, even though Yugoslavia was the name when the photo was taken]
Russia (Federation)--Leningradskaia oblast--Saint Petersburg [use current form, even though it was called Leningrad in Soviet Union, when photo was taken]

customization.para: Egypt
Egypt--Alexandria
Egypt--Cairo--Jizah
Egypt--Dayr al-Bahri Site
Egypt--Nile River Delta
Israel--West Bank--Jericho

history.justification: Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection wanted to display the location of a building realized using the drawing.

definition.para: Type of drawing.

instructions.para: Enter the type of drawing
Input a term or terms from the Getty Art and Architecture Thesaurus.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the thesaurus.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

history.justification: Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection wanted to state the purpose of any given drawing.

definition.para: A drawing's type of represention.

instructions.para: Enter the type of representation that best describes the drawing.
Input a term or terms from the Getty Art and Architecture Thesaurus.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

history.justification: Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection wanted to state this difficult-to-define property.

definition.para: An account of the resource.
Notes include any information of importance that is not represented elsewhere.

instructions.para: Each separate "note" should be a paragraph. Additional notes can be added, separated from the previous note using a blank line.
Each separate "note" should be a paragraph. Additional notes can be added, separated from the previous note using a blank line.

customization.para: An account of the drawing.
Notes include any information of importance that is not represented elsewhere.

example.para: Photographs taken by Asahel Curtis during his trip to the Klondike in 1897-1899.
Handwritten on verso: Mrs. McLain with dog team.
Photographs taken by Asahel Curtis during his trip to the Klondike in 1897-1899.
Handwritten on verso: Mrs. McLain with dog team.

customization.para: Handwritten in title block: Apartment house. Osborn, Architect. 325 Leary Bldg., Seattle, Wash. E.C.R. [drawn by?]
Handwritten beneath drawing: First floor plan. Scale: 1/16" to 1'
Plans for a frame hotel to be erected by the Lake View Land Co. at Lakeview, Wash.
Stamped on cover sheet: Farrell and Darmer, Architects, Tacoma, Wash. Ter.
From inventory: (1890)
Residence for Mr. C.J. Lord

Written in title block: Residence for Mr. C.J. Lord; 21st and Columbia Streets, Olympia, Washington; Basement and Foundation plan; Joseph H. Wohleb, Architect. Olympia, Wash.; Drawn by Y.D.W.; Traced by W.W.; Date Feb. 1923;Comm. No. 251; Sheet no. 2; Scale: 1/4" to 1'

generalNotes.para: "Notes" is distingushed from "Historical Notes" mainly because it descibes the image/resource only. Values in this field also may be considered more "indexable" insofar as they precisely descibe the image/resource. "HistoricalNotes" are more like "writing" and create a braod historical context.

history.justification: Needed a place to enter all "other" information valuable to the description of the resource.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Added customization for Architecture of the Pacific Northwest.

definition.para: Architectural style, chronological period, nationality, and/or culture that describes structure represented by the drawing.

instructions.para: Enter a term or terms that best describes the architectural style, chronological period, nationality, and/or culture that describes structure represented by the drawing.
Recommended: use a term from the Getty Art and Architecture Thesaurus.

history.justification: Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection wanted to describe drawing by architectural style.

definition.para: An account of the resource.

instructions.para: Enter information about the architects, the history of the project, observations about the drawings or buildings, and other historical notes and observations.

example.para: oseph H. Wohleb practiced independently in Olympia from 1911-1945. He joined his son Robert in 1946 to form Wohleb and Wohleb. After the death of Joseph in 1958, Robert carried on the business as Wohleb and Associates until 1966.

This drawing shows a preliminary design of an observation tower and restaurant for the 1962 Seattle World's Fair Exhibition. Set on the only section of the fair grounds that was not owned by the city, the site did not have the height restrictions of other exhibits/pavillions at the fair. The lot, 37-by-37 m, was purchased by private investors for $75,000 and is still privately owned. Although there is much contention surrounding who came up with the final design of the Space Needle, John Graham is widely acknowledged as its architect.

history.justification: Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection wanted a place to put something like historical notes.

definition.para: The topic of the resource.

instructions.para: Terms in this field are taken from the LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Terms in this field are taken from the LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.

history.justification: We wanted a subject field that distinguishes TGM headings from other subject headings, to get the full benefits of using a controlled vocabulary.

definition.para: The topic of the resource.

instructions.para: Terms in this field are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH).
Use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Terms in this field are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH).
Use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.

history.justification: We wanted a subject field that distinguishes LCSH headings from other subject headings, to get the full benefits of using a controlled vocabulary.

definition.para: Name of the digital collection; may be the same name as the original repository collection.

instructions.para: Enter the name given to the digital collection.
Enter the name given to the digital collection.

history.justification: Needed to specify which digital collection every item is a part of.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Number that users can reference to order a copy of the digital image.

instructions.para: Enter the order number.
Enter the order number.

history.justification: Special Collections wants a identifier for the image in CONTENTdm

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Instructions for ordering.

instructions.para: Enter the instructions for ordering. If the item cannot be ordered, state that it cannot be ordered.

example.para: To order a reproduction, inquire about permissions, or for information about prices see: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcollections/services/reproduction/reproduction.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted all items to have ordering instructions.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Citation/identifier for the resource.

instructions.para: Enter citation in accordance with procedure developed in UW Libraries Special Collections.

admin.para: Instructions needed; must be obtained from UW Libraries Special Collections.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted an effective identifier for users to identify resources, especially when ordering items.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The Negative number refers to the reproduction number assigned to the image for purposes of duplication. It is the unique number by which Special Collections identifies the image. It may be identical to another number in the record.

instructions.para: Enter the negative number. If two negatives numbers are associated with an image, these are to be separated by a semicolon.

history.justification: Special Collections needed a place to record the negative number.

definition.para: The institution where the item is physically located.

instructions.para: Enter the name of the repository in which the original item is held.
Enter the name of the repository in which the original item is held.

example.para: University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections Division
Eastern Washington State Historical Society/Cheney Cowles
Museum Museum of History and Industry, Seattle
University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections Division

Museum Museum of History and Industry, Seattle

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a place to descrbe the holding repository.

Also made //uwRequired="yes".

definition.para: This field contains the collection name and its number, represented as a phrase.

instructions.para: Input the name assigned by the holding repository to the original collection.
Input the name assigned by the holding repository to the original collection.

Also made //uwRequired="yes".

definition.para: This field contains the URI to the EAD finding aid.

instructions.para: Enter only the URI to the EAD finding aid.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a link to the finding aid displayed.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Describes the digital conversion process, date scanned, etc.

instructions.para: Input a paragraph with pertinent information on the digital conversion process.
Input a paragraph with pertinent information on the digital conversion process of the overall object.

example.para: Scanned from a photographic print using a Microtek Scanmaker 9600XL at 72 dpi in JPEG format at compression rate 3. 10/1998.
Scanned from original text or image at 400 dpi saved in TIFF format, resized and enhanced using Adobe Photoshop, and imported as JPEG2000 using Contentdm software's JPEG2000 Extension. 2006.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a description of the digitization process.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: A person or organization not specified in the Creator field or Photographer field who has made a significant contribution to the resource, but whose contribution is secondary to any person or organization specified in the Creator field.

instructions.para: Input name of the contributor.
Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names.
Input name of the contributor.
Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names.

example.para: University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections Division
University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections Division

history.justification: Special Collections wanted to use this property for describing the contribution of the University of Washington Libraries.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Source and date of acquisition of the resource.

instructions.para: Input text describing the source and date of acquisition of the resource.
Input text describing the source and date of acquisition of the resource.

example.para: Gift of Aubrey Watzek, 1953; acc. no. 53-1634
Gift of Aubrey Watzek, 1953; acc. no. 53-1634

admin.para: Some collections have mysterious values for this property; for example, the only value for this property in ayp is "KK."

history.justification: Uncertain; Special Collections wanted to enter information on how selected images were acquired (but it's not clear why they would want to input that information in CONTENTdm).

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: URI that dereferences to a rights statement.

instructions.para: Enter a rights statement from rightsstatements.org.
For items with a date later than 1922, enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/ ("In Copyright"); for all else enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/CNE/1.0/ ("Copyright Not Evaluated.")
Enter a rights statement from rightsstatements.org that pertains to the entire object.
If all items have a date later than 1922, enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/ ("In Copyright"); for all else enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/CNE/1.0/ ("Copyright Not Evaluated.")

history.justification: Wanted a machine-actionable rights statement, and the property allows us to be compliant with Orbis Cascade Alliance Dublin Core Best Practices at first experimental harvest in June 2017.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Any restrictions on the use of an image.

instructions.para: Input the following text: "For information on permissions for use and reproductions please visit UW Libraries Special Collections "Reproductions: Order Photographs & Scans" page: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcoll/service/reproduction.html."

Input the following text: "For information on permissions for use and reproductions please visit UW Libraries Special Collections "Reproductions: Order Photographs & Scans" page: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcoll/service/reproduction.html."

customization.para: Enter "For information on permissions for use and reproductions please visit UW Libraries Special Collections Use Permissions page: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcollections/services/permission-for-use"

example.para: For information on permissions for use and reproductions please visit UW Libraries Special Collections "Reproductions: Order Photographs & Scans" page: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcoll/service/reproduction.html.

typeAttribute.fixed: For information on permissions for use and reproductions please visit UW Libraries Special Collections Use Permissions page: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcollections/services/permission-for-use

definition.para: Describes the nature or genre of the content of the resource.

instructions.para: Input a value from the Dublin Core Type Vocabulary at http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/.
Input a value from the Dublin Core Type Vocabulary at http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/.
Optional: input a value from the Dublin Core Type Vocabulary at http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/.
Not required for all compound object items. Use as needed. Recommended: enter type values when the collection resources are mixed media.

generalNotes.para: Does output in OAI-PMH, mapped to dc:identifier.
Does not appear to be searchable in the cdm collection; it does not appear to be an indexed field.

It does appear to be the persistent URI for the resource (in its context; not a uri for the actual resource, the image); however the reference URI outputs perfectly in OAI-PMH; it outputs however in cdm exports with port 80 added to the base URI (http://cdm16786.contentdm.oclc.org:80/).

history.justification: Needed a system-created identifier.
